edu.stanford.cs.pptx

Class PPRect

  • Object
    • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPShape
      • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPTextShape
        • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPAutoShape
          • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPRect
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PPTextBox

    public class PPRect
extends PPAutoShape
    This class represents a rectangular box in a PowerPoint slide. The usual approach to working with a PPRect shape is to create a new PPRect object and then to add that object to a slide, as illustrated in the following code, which creates a 100x100-pixel solid red square whose upper left corner is at the point (200, 100): 
        PPSlide slide = new PPSlide();
    PPRect square = new PPRect(100, 100);
    square.setColor(Color.RED);
    slide.add(square, 200, 100);
    It is also possible to set properties of the PPRect shape, either by passing an option string to the constructor or by invoking methods in the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PPRect

        public PPRect(double x,
              double y,
              double width,
              double height)
        Creates a new PPRect shape with the specified coordinates and size. Coordinates and distances are consistent with the Java graphics model. All distances are measured in pixels, and the origin for the coordinate system is in the upper left corner of the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the upper left corner
        y - The y coordinate of the upper left corner
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle

      • PPRect

        public PPRect(double x,
              double y,
              double width,
              double height,
              String options)
        Creates a new PPRect shape from the specified coordinates and size. This version of the constructor operates in much the same manner as the standard PPRect constructor, but allows the caller to specify an option string. The advantage of embedding the option string in the constructor is that doing so often makes it possible to add the shape to the slide immediately without storing it in a temporary variable.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the upper left corner
        y - The y coordinate of the upper left corner
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle
        options - The options string

      • PPRect

        public PPRect(double width,
              double height)
        Creates a new PPRect shape from its dimensions. This version of the constructor is useful when you want to create the shape and then add it to the slide at a position computed subsequently.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle

      • PPRect

        public PPRect(double width,
              double height,
              String options)
        Creates a new PPRect shape from its dimensions and an options string.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle
        options - The options string

        options - The options string

    • Method Detail

      • setScale

        public void setScale(double sf)
        Scales the shape uniformly by sf in each dimension. Note that this method changes the initial scale factor of the shape and does not offer a mechanism to scale a shape dynamically.
        Parameters:
        sf - The scale factor

      • setScale

        public void setScale(double sx,
                     double sy)
        Scales the shape independently along the two coordinate axes. Note that this method changes the initial scale factor of the shape and does not offer a mechanism to scale a shape dynamically.
        Parameters:
        sx - The scale factor in the x direction
        sy - The scale factor in the y direction

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(double theta)
        Rotates the shape counterclockwise by theta degrees. Note that this method changes the initial orientation of the shape and does not offer a mechanism to rotate a shape dynamically.
        Parameters:
        theta - The number of degrees by which the shape is rotated

      • getRotation

        public double getRotation()
        Returns the rotation angle of the shape.
        Returns:
        The rotation angle of the shape

      • setColor

        public void setColor(Color color)
        Sets both the line and fill color of the shape to the specified color.
        Parameters:
        color - The new color for both the outline and the interior

      • setColor

        public void setColor(String str)
        Sets both the line and fill color of the shape to the specified color, which is either a standard color name or a string in the form "#rrggbb".
        Parameters:
        str - The new color expressed as a string

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(Color color)
        Sets the fill color of the shape.
        Parameters:
        color - The new fill color

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(String str)
        Sets the fill color of the shape to the specified color, which is either a standard color name or a string in the form "#rrggbb". The string "none" can be used to specify an unfilled shape.
        Parameters:
        str - The new color expressed as a string

      • getFillColor

        public Color getFillColor()
        Gets the fill color of the shape.
        Returns:
        The fill color of the shape

      • setStartArrow

        public void setStartArrow(String str)
        Sets the arrow mode for the start of the line. The arrow mode is a hyphen-separated string consisting of the type (triangle, stealth, diamond, oval, circle, or arrow), a size indicator for the width of the arrowhead (large, medium, or small), and a similar size indicator for the length of the arrowhead.
        Parameters:
        str - A string indicating the arrowhead style and shape

      • getStartArrow

        public String getStartArrow()
        Gets the arrow mode for the start of the line.
        Returns:
        A string indicating the arrowhead style and shape

      • setEndArrow

        public void setEndArrow(String str)
        Sets the arrow mode for the end of the line. The arrow mode is a hyphen-separated string consisting of the type (triangle, stealth, diamond, oval, circle, or arrow), a size indicator for the width of the arrowhead (large, medium, or small), and a similar size indicator for the length of the arrowhead.
        Parameters:
        str - A string indicating the arrowhead style and shape

      • getEndArrow

        public String getEndArrow()
        Gets the arrow mode for the end of the line.
        Returns:
        A string indicating the arrowhead style and shape
